biography: Albert Einstein was a theoretical physicist who developed the theory of relativity, one of the two pillars of modern physics.
Isaac Newton was an English mathematician, physicist, astronomer, and author who is widely recognized for formulating the laws of motion and universal gravitation.
Marie Curie was a pioneering physicist and chemist who conducted groundbreaking research on radioactivity and was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize.
Nikola Tesla was an inventor and electrical engineer known for his contributions to the development of alternating current (AC) electrical systems.
Stephen Hawking was an English theoretical physicist, cosmologist, and author, known for his work on black holes and relativity.
Galileo Galilei was an Italian astronomer, physicist, and engineer, often called the 'father of modern science' for his pioneering use of experimentation.
Charles Darwin was an English naturalist, geologist, and biologist, best known for his theory of evolution by natural selection.
Richard Feynman was an American theoretical physicist known for his work in quantum mechanics and particle physics.
Jane Goodall is a British primatologist and anthropologist, considered the world's foremost expert on chimpanzees.
Carl Sagan was an American astronomer, astrophysicist, and science communicator, known for popularizing science.
Shahid Kapoor is an Indian actor known for Jab We Met, Haider, and Kabir Singh.
Kriti Sanon is an Indian actress known for Heropanti, Luka Chuppi, and Mimi.
Disha Patani is an Indian actress known for MS Dhoni: The Untold Story and Baaghi 2.
Madhuri Dixit is an Indian actress known for her dancing skills and roles in films like Dil, Hum Aapke Hain Koun..! and Devdas.
Vidya Balan is an Indian actress known for strong female-centric roles in Kahaani, The Dirty Picture, and Tumhari Sulu.
Taapsee Pannu is an Indian actress known for Pink, Badla, and Thappad.
Alia Bhatt is an Indian actress known for Raazi, Gully Boy, and Highway.

Barack Obama served as the 44th President of the United States from 2009 to 2017.
Narendra Modi is the 14th Prime Minister of India, serving since 2014.
Angela Merkel is a German politician who served as Chancellor of Germany from 2005 to 2021.
Vladimir Putin is a Russian politician serving as the President of Russia since 2012.
Joe Biden is the 46th President of the United States, serving since 2021.
Jacinda Ardern served as the Prime Minister of New Zealand from 2017 to 2023.
Emmanuel Macron is the President of France since 2017.
Theresa May served as the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 2016 to 2019.

biography: Winston Churchill was a British statesman, army officer, and writer who served as Prime Minister during World War II.

biography: Mahatma Gandhi was the leader of the Indian independence movement against British rule, employing nonviolent civil disobedience.

Freddie Mercury was the lead vocalist of the rock band Queen, famed for his powerful voice and charismatic stage presence.
Michael Jackson was an American singer, songwriter and dancer — dubbed the 'King of Pop' — and one of the best-selling music artists of all time.
Stevie Wonder is an American singer-songwriter, multi-instrumentalist and record producer, known for his contributions to soul, R&B, and pop music.
